title: (x) Amica Magazine - Cheltenham (custom version) {Mark S}
content:
There is a good chance it is custom, but even then there could be some typeface which looks similar?   
 ![amica](http://web.archive.org/web/20110622210149im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/69080.jpg)
author: hackum

comments.content:
From the C and A especially, it must have been based on a Caslon.   
Tim

I disagree about Caslon, because it seems to me only the A and C have any sort of Caslon similarity -- the other letters are much more like a classic Roman titling type. (My copy of the FontBook is not handy, or I might suggest a few similar ones.)   
   
FWIW, AMICA is listed as a client of Font Bureau, although this typeface doesn't resemble any FB styles I have seen.

Thank you both for your input.   
   
From what I was able to find online, there are several Amica magazines; one of which is German:   
 [http://www.madonnatribe.com/images\_covers/amica\_2000.JPG](http://web.archive.org/web/20110622210149/http:/www.madonnatribe.com/images_covers/amica_2000.JPG)   
   
Probably FontBureau worked with them? The mast looks like Agenda to me.

This looks to me like a reduced-weight [Cheltenham Oldstyle](http://web.archive.org/web/20110622210149/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/cheltenham-old-style/cheltenham-old-style/testdrive.html?s=AMICA&p=48). I believe Font Bureau did something like that for the New York Times Magazine, but I don't know if this is the same one.

Mark is right - it looks very much like the NYT mag's redesign of Cheltenham, which is not (as far as I know) commercially available.   
   
 [http://www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/25489.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20110622210149/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/25489.html)

Went out and bought the magazine today. Here is a scan from one of the pages. I am almost sure now it is the custom work by FontBureau Mike and Mark mentioned. It is a beautiful and exquisite face in my opinion.   
   
The other FontBureau typefaces used in the magazine: FB Agenda Light and FB Agenda Regular (for captions and short paragraphs), FB Giza Seven Five (from what I can tell) for some of the titles.   
   
Can anyone provide a scan of the NY Times version of the font?   
   
 ![2](http://web.archive.org/web/20110622210149im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/69155.gif)

I'd be happy to scan the NYT magazine font (which I don't think is quite as light as this) but it won't arrive on my doorstep until saturday morning, hope you can wait until then.   
   
That lower case g is definitely Cheltenham.

I'd be happy to scan a sample of the NY Times mag font but hope you can wait until saturday when my copy arrives. I don't think it's quite as light as this.   
   
That lower case g confirms its Cheltenham origins.

Here as promised is a sample from the New York Times. It's very close but not quite as delicate.   
   
Note to the Europeans: please ignore the content. I apologize for my stupid country.   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20110622210149im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/69211.jpg)

Thanks!   
   
It looks like both typefaces are the same, the one in Amica being a little thinner(or it might be bad scanning on my part.) Mystery solved ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20110622210149im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)
